creator: mnikhil@gmail.com
text:
Hi,

I have recently got mod_jk and got it compiled for Solaris 10-11/06 and when I
actually try to use it with JBoss. mod_jk dumps core. 

Could someone please let me know if they too have faced the problem and a
workaround if there is any for it already ?

Although mod_jk is not part of httpd (it belongs to Tomcat or more precise to
Tomcat connectors) a backtrace will be needed in any case to find out what
happened. Please have a look at http://httpd.apache.org/dev/debugging.html how
to create a backtrace. Furthermore please provide the version of mod_jk you are
using.
creator: rpluem@apache.org

text:
Pasting last comment from 41495:

Thanks Nick. Refiling under tomcat. [I do not know what to be said with which
the Product version I have to chose ]

I am using the Sun provided apache2 under Solaris-10 11/06 release at

$ /usr/apache2/bin/httpd -v
Server version: Apache/2.0.58
Server built:   Sep  5 2006 07:20:21


$ /usr/apache2/bin/httpd -V
Server version: Apache/2.0.58
Server built:   Sep  5 2006 07:20:21
Server's Module Magic Number: 20020903:12
Server loaded:  APR 0.9.12, APR-UTIL 0.9.12
Compiled using: APR 0.9.12, APR-UTIL 0.9.12
Architecture:   32-bit
Server compiled with....
 -D APACHE_MPM_DIR="server/mpm/prefork"
 -D APR_HAS_MMAP
 -D APR_HAVE_IPV6 (IPv4-mapped addresses enabled)
 -D APR_USE_FCNTL_SERIALIZE
 -D APR_USE_PTHREAD_SERIALIZE
 -D SINGLE_LISTEN_UNSERIALIZED_ACCEPT
 -D APR_HAS_OTHER_CHILD
 -D AP_HAVE_RELIABLE_PIPED_LOGS
 -D HTTPD_ROOT="/usr/apache2"
 -D SUEXEC_BIN="/usr/apache2/bin/suexec"
 -D DEFAULT_PIDLOG="/var/run/apache2/httpd.pid"
 -D DEFAULT_SCOREBOARD="logs/apache_runtime_status"
 -D DEFAULT_LOCKFILE="/var/run/apache2/accept.lock"
 -D DEFAULT_ERRORLOG="logs/error_log"
 -D AP_TYPES_CONFIG_FILE="/etc/apache2/mime.types"
 -D SERVER_CONFIG_FILE="/etc/apache2/httpd.conf"

I have got mod_jk 1.2.20 compiled myself with SunStudio-11.0

Please let me know for any other details if required.

Thanks,
Nikhil
creator: rpluem@apache.org
